messages.content: How do I install the ergouzi-DGNJD repository for ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes?

To install the ergouzi-DGNJD repository, first open the command line terminal and then switch to your ComfyUI's 'custom_nodes' directory using 'cd /path/to/your/ComfyUI/custom_nodes' command, replacing '/path/to/your/ComfyUI' with your actual path. Then use the command 'git clone https://github.com/11dogzi/Comfyui-ergouzi-Nodes.git' to clone the repository.
What are the types of prompt word nodes provided by the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes setup?

The ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes setup provides numerous optional types of prompt word nodes that can be randomly selected. Additionally, it includes custom type random prompt word nodes, where users can choose the type according to their needs and then randomly generate the prompt words.
How can I use the nodes for more flexible local processing methods such as cropping, recognizing cropped areas, and processing them back to the original image?

The nodes in the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes are designed to offer a flexible local processing approach. Users can crop the masked area and automatically recognize the cropped area. The nodes then process the cropped area back to the original image through other nodes, which works particularly well with semantic segmentation.
Can I add a text watermark to my images using the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes?
Yes, with the watermark master of the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes, you can generate text watermarks or upload finished product watermarks. You can also batch-load images and add watermarks in batches.
Can I load PSD files and update them in real-time with the conventional image processing nodes of the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes?
Yes, the conventional image processing nodes in the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes allow you to load any image, including PSD files, and they support real-time updates.
What tools are available in the Regular Mask Processing nodes for managing and manipulating masks?
The Regular Mask Processing nodes of the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes offer tools for managing and manipulating masks, including options for mask processing and mask feathering.
Do I need to provide API credentials every time I use the Baidu Translation API in the ComfyUI-ergouzi-Nodes?
No, you only need to enter your Baidu Translation API ID and key the first time you use the API. After that, you can use the API without providing the credentials again.
